intro: Sisymbrium exasperatum, commonly known as the bitter rocket, is an annual flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous species. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a peppery or spicy scent when crushed. Sisymbrium exasperatum is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
